I highly recommend the nachos - this is the thing that brings us back late at night many a time.  They're baked in the brick ovens with real cheese melted right on top, and big chunks of juicy tomatoes strewn throughout.  You can even add chili to the nachos for a little more bite!

Other great menu items include the pizzas (also baked in the brick ovens, and personal-sized, although you may have a piece or two left to take home with you) and the grilled psychedelic, their portabella mushroom sandwich.  The dive diner fries are crispy, perfectly-seasoned waffle fries, and they come on a plate big enough to feed the full party at your table.

Some notes: during the school year (Sept - beginning of May), crowds can be bad at half-price.  If you're over 21, my advice is to get there shortly before (they won't seat anyone for just half-price until 11 itself) and order your drink.  The awesome waitstaff will wait to put your food order in until the clock hits 11, and then you won't be so pressed to find a seat.

There is a small section of the menu that is not half-price, but it's clearly labeled so you're aware.  

Brunch is 11-2 on Sundays, and on Steeler game days especially, it can get crowded.  We always try to get there just after 11 to get a table.

Downstairs, they have a large seating section that can accommodate groups.  I hosted the NaNoWriMo kick-off party there one year, and they put up with us bringing our laptops while enjoying our brunch.  Just call in advance if you know you're having a huge party (I know Pitt has also hosted writing program reading events here from time to time).

Parking is the only truly chancey thing about this place, but they're right on a bus line, and if you live in Oakland or the surrounding areas, just walk over.  You're guaranteed to want to eat a lot, so mightaswell get your exercise in ahead of time :)

Another Oakland staple, Fuel & Fuddle is the go-to gastropub for Pitt students. Fuel's vibe is meant to appeal to the college student's "indulgent" tendencies. Menu items names like "rollafatty," "rump shaker," and "grilled psychedelic" all play into this theme; not to mention the blatant "Route 420" painted on the wall. Food-wise, pizzas, sandwiches, wings, and their signature mixed sweet potato/traditional fries will absolutely satisfy your cravings, regardless of whether or not those cravings were influenced by any botanical studies you and your friends conducted beforehand. Pitt isn't a STEM school for nothing, amiright?

With over 100 drink options, Fuel is a great place for new and old alcohol fans to try new beers and such. The low price late night menu begins after 11PM; I've spent countless nights chowing down here with my friends. I've noticed that the food quality goes down at 11PM: fries are dry from sitting outside the fryer, pizza crusts can get more burnt, turkey burger is not formed as well as it should be, etc. Regardless, it's still delicious and totally worth it: you get what you pay for at that hour.

Fuel & Fuddle is a favorite among college kids in the area, and I am no exception. Late night is fantastic: featuring all the greasy foods we crave at night for great prices. Fuel & Fuddle is also a great place to meet up with friends, especially if you can get a table in the basement where it's quieter. 
The only thing I don't love about this place is the noise level and sometimes the food quality suffers on really busy nights- but more than 95% of my experiences have been phenomenal.

As a Pitt grad, Fuel and Fuddle has always been one of  my staples.  It may not be the best restaurant in Oakland but they have a great selection of food and beers and they served sweet potato fries long before they were popular.  My favorite item on the menu is the smashed potato pizza.  Who knew that mashed potatoes, chicken, ranch, lettuce and tomato on a pizza could be so tasty?   I was dubious at first but there is something about it that works so well.  I'd recommend any of the brick oven pizzas.  If you're there after 11PM, food is half off but it gets really crowded at that time especially during the School year.   

If you come just for drinks, you'll find that the bar area is pretty small.  They also have a downstairs area that can accomodate larger groups .

Whenever you have a spot to run to with a nice selection of beer, good food and a decent atmosphere, you have to keep going. 
A friend of mine is or was a regular at this spot, and when a friend was celebrating being something over 30, he took over the basement for Jeopardy and I hate to say it, but I ran that mother and my team was in the lead the whole time. 
But wait! There's more... they had some very impressive grub, and the waitress kept her cool even though she was weaving in and out of a very thirsty crowd of about 20 members of this private party. She kept her cool, and hats off to her. 
I mosied on up the stairs to see what was happening above ground, and it was pretty good. I think they might become a part of my regular stop-throughs when I am in town.
Small bar in Oakland, Fuel and Fuddle is crowded on Pitt basketball game days. They have an extensive beer selection and so-so food.

I've never been to F&F for the late night half price food but have been there a couple times for dinner and drinks. The beer selection is awesome. I personally love the fire-baked brie which comes out nice and warm and has honey drizzled all over it. When you cut the breading, the cheese just melts out. I'm a big fan of the Porky's Revenge Pizza and the Filler Up pizza.  The burgers are decent and I usually get the sweet potato fries with them because they are so much better than regular fries. Overall, a good place to eat. If you do want to go for half price late night special, make sure you get there early because there is usually a line outside.

Used to frequent here in college, and just went back a few weeks ago.  Menu is still super legit and reasonably priced.  The veggie burger patty is really great and made in house.  Their different aiolis are also all wonderful.  I love that they have cocktails in pint glasses!  Still a great place for some comfort food and boozing.

Fuel and Fuddle stands out when it comes to quick and easy "bar food". Apps, burgers, and beer are definitely their specialty. I had a byo burger, that had dozens of topping choices, which is awesome. Something to note however, my burger came with both sweet potato fries and regular fries (little weird). My dad had a one of F&F's pizzas which was decent, but not the best. Another food group to note is the apps, I had the nachos and the pierogis, both outstanding. If you aren't a cheese person the nachos may not be for you. I would definitely recommend the pierogis though. Along with the food, our waitress for the night was nothing short of fantastic. She was attentive and knew her stuff when it came to the menu and the beers. You could tell she's tried the food and drinks and led you down the right path. 

Next, the ambiance is very casual. The sound level is on the higher side, but it's all within the range of the type of place Fuel and Fuddle is. 

Overall, Fuel and Fuddle has excellent bar food, and with my experience a great waitress. I would definitely recommend F&F to anyone in down town Pittsburgh. It's a great place.

I've been here several times, most recently Nov. of last year.  Fuel and Fuddle is one of those restaurants you go to expecting to have a great time, and that you'll enjoy the food because of that (ahem, Mad Mex).  While the food here is decent, I wouldn't say that it's anything to write home about, in particular.  The smashed potato pizza is pretty good, esp. with rosemary chicken on top, as are the "skinny" dip, nachos, and sweet potato fries.  I really think people come here to drink, more than anything else.  I'm not a beer drinker, so I can't comment on the beer (which is what most people seem to order), but some of their mixed drinks are interesting.  They have one that's mint flavored that I especially enjoy (forget what it's called)--but then again, I'm one of those weirdos who enjoys mint-flavored drinks (cf. my review on Union Pig and Chicken).  Overall, a fun place to come with a group or a few friends to get some drinks and munchies, but don't expect gastropub-quality eats.

A staple on my Pittsburgh food rotation, especially when I lived in Oakland. It would get 3 stars if it wasn't for their half-price late night special which brings the food to a price that is so ridiculously cheap that it feels almost wrong. Plus a great beer selection--I loooove their house Fire Brick Brown Ale, brewed by Smuttynose.

Favorite things on the menu: Wings (seriously addictive bleu cheese, but unfortunately no celery), amazing sweet potato fries, and the Chipotle Polka--spicy mini-pierogies loaded with cheese, bacon, carmelized onions, and sour cream.

Avoid: The burgers are terrible, which is weird since they share ownership with Burgatory. Also not a fan of the too-sweet pizza dough.

Go before the half-price special starts at 11pm to put your name in for a table, or be prepared for a loooooong wait among lots of undergrads.

Fuel & Fuddle always seems to be crowded, whether it's lunch, dinner, late night, or summer. It's a very typical college town local bar kind of establishment. That said, the space is a bit too tight for my tastes--tables are situated pretty close to each other, and conversations are loud. Service can be a hit or miss, as it's always so busy in there. 

Food is pretty decent; they have a long menu and lots of sandwiches, burgers, and plates, as well as small bites. Somewhat pricey, but they do have late night, which is great for the area. Overall a fine stop if you are looking for the right atmosphere.

Go after 11pm for the half priced food and experience one of the best bar-food menus in Pittsburgh. The sweet-potato fries are the best I've ever had, the pizzas are always good, and the sandwiches are big. When I go I mostly order off of the appetizer menu.  Never had a bad time here, but if you aren't there at 11pm then expect a wait of up to 40 minutes. I've had some people be skeptical when I've said it's worth the wait, but I've never had a complaint once the food came. Also it isn't very expensive before the half-off, so I've been here many times during the day - you just feel kind of bad that you could be getting it for so much less

What is a fuddle? Nobody knows.  

I hate the name of this place.  It sounds sooooo dumb.  They should re-name it something less dumb-sounding.

I used to call it "That loud place," because I couldn't remember what it's called, and it's really really loud inside.  

Aside from that stuff, though, the experience here is pretty good.  The food quality's pretty decent, the service is usually quick.  A friend of mine swears by the nachos, enough so that he generally won't order them from anywhere else.  

If you don't mind loud (and if you're in Oakland, you better get used to it,) Fuel and Fuddle is just fine.  Except the name.  The name's really stupid.

Fuel and Fuddle never ever disappoints.  Nestled in the urban campus of the University of Pittsburgh, this unpretentious place serves great food, and boasts a down to earth staff that consistently provides great service.  I especially love the pizza, the nachos (with chicken chili), and the "Goin' cold turkey" sandwich made with actual real turkey.  Imagine that!  It's a great place that makes you feel young, even if you aren't.  A great selection of beer is yet another reason why I keep coming back to Fuel &Fuddle.  Hungry and don't know where to go?  Run, don't walk, to Fuel & Fuddle.  Do it.  NOW.

Excellent food, excellent beer, excellent staff. The only bad thing on the menu I have tried is the cucumber salad. 

I particularly recommend their beer mussels appetizer, Ice Ice Baby wrap (shrimp wrap), and naked truth pizza.

Very sad to discover that their signature bread and fries are now just like every other bar. I'm glad they were able to stay open, but, these were the things that made it unique. Bummer that they couldn't maintain that standard.

Another restaurant on our Pittsburgh list of must eats, and was very satisfied!! Our server was very attentive and nice, and the food was amazing! We got the pesto pizza, bbq wings and the hog heaven. The hog heaven was really good and came with a side of a nice horse radish dip and also came with a mix of sweet potato fries as regular fries. The pesto chicken pizza is among my top 10 best pizzas I've ever had! And the wings were flavorful and crispy!! We came for the late night deals and a local recommendation. Would definitely be back for more!

Just one word,  Nachos. I am determined to find the best in the Burgh, and this place is on the watch list.  Chicken Chili, fresh jalepenos (they have to be fresh!), sour cream, cheese, sliced black olives.   So good!  My only complaint is no salsa or huac (which I love.) Still they will be in my running to enter best 'chos!  Keep up the good working Fuel, and thanks for refueling me!   (I had to)

When I went to Pitt, this was an absolute favorite of mine. It was the standard place I would take family or friends when they visited. The food is always delicious, well priced, and never disappointing and the service is always on point even when it's a crazy busy Saturday afternoon. You must start with the wings. Big, meaty, crispy. Just perfect! As far as entrees some of my favorites include Rosemary's Breast, the pulled pork sandwich, or the fried fish sandwich. The pizzas are always great too - thin crispy crust. Or be adventurous and try the alligator stew. Ugh wish I was back in the burgh!
Just go for a drink. It's a cool environment and the bar is excellent. The food is average and a little pricy; if you do decide to order some, go late-night for the specials!

One things I miss about being a college student in Pittsburgh is this place. It's hard to find any other city where you get half price and delicious food in large quantities this late at night.

Late night starts from 11pm-1am when the kitchen closes. During this time, mostly everything is half off except for some of the big platters, seafood dishes, and drinks.

Recommendations:
Wings - messy but so good, I always go with the standard buffalo but the other flavors are great too, wings are large, crispy, and juicy.

Dip sticks - Definitely pay that $1 extra and add the mozz. Great rosemary flatbread and marinara sauce. Cheese makes it even better.

Roll-a-fatty - Kind of like a calzone but better because it's half off and you get extra marinara sauce to dip.

Pizzas - A little bigger than a personal pan, but easily finished by one person. I like the Classic Maggie and all the ones with lots of MEAT. My friends always get the Smashed Potato, but I've never liked it since it tastes likes salad on a pizza.

I've never been here not during late night so no idea how it is during normal hours, but it's always been crowded every time I've been here.It's especially crowded on Thurs-Sat. because of all the college students. Don't be surprised with up to an hour's wait. Best time to go though is to get there either around 10:30pm to wait in line for late night to begin, or around 12-12:30pm right before their kitchen closes.

I finally found thin crust pizza in Pittsburgh! No thick, doughy crust! I ordered the Naked Truth. I would have liked a lot more basil and a few more tomatoes, but the crust, sauce and cheese were excellent. They also have a solid local craft beer selection. I'll be back.

Met my college friends at Fuel today. I hadn't been there in over 10 years. The atmosphere was exactly the same, chill, hip, familiar. The food is unique. Our service was good, great beer selection. The nachos were stale but our entrees made up for it. Great food, great atmosphere, great beer.

I was seated immediately upon arrival. Their beer menu was extensive and gave me the option to choose something I had never had before. After drinks I ordered the smashed potato pie. It's was good but it was nothing extraordinary. My one complaint is that when I attempted to go down to the bathroom the urinal was filled with puke. Other than that it was a good low budget meal.

Food: I think I have only gotten wings from this place. Hot Wings, Jerk Wings. I can't recall what other types of wings I have eaten from here. Big wings is what Fuel and FUddle gives the customers.

Fries: Regular fries are cool. Nothing special. It was this place that I first had sweet potato fries. They are thin cut fries and are solid. Again, nothing special.

Workers: College students. Never had a problem with anybody.

Atmosphere: Nice spot after hours. Feeds the entire University of Pittsburgh Campus. Dark and dim during the night and you can catch a live performance every once in a while.

This place will always have my respect because I associate my college experience with their wings. Much respect Fuel and Fuddle.

Solid spot.

Wow. Really really disappointing. Got the Moby dick (fish sandwich). I would have been happier if it were bland.  Instead it was just plain awful. The batter was overlooked and the steaming pile of fish within was just awful. How to describe awful? Foul taste. Just that. Amped by the fact that the slaw on top tasted terrible and the water was retained in the fish after it was cooked so it quickly turned into a sloppy mess at the first bite. The fries were fine so there's that and the beer was good but that is the only positive. Not gonna complain but never getting food again. Ugh.
Pizza was excellent!  Wings great and burgers was spot on..love the sweet potato fries...and $2 Yuenglings can't beat that, Sunday special.

Meh.  This place really doesn't have anything great going for it.  The food is OK, but with Uncle Sams, Mad Mex, and other great spots only a stones throw away, I don't really see the appeal of this place.  Apparently the local beers and waffle fries are good, but I had to go for the Yingling.

My husband and I went to Fuel and Fuddle based purely on the fact that it was open late and we were starving after our movie.  The thought that first struck me when I arrived was that the floor was covered in trash; dirty napkins, straws, french fries, and who knows what else.  

We were seated at a small table and the backs of the booth seats were cinder blocks--not comfortable at all.  Then we were handed sticky menus, which prompted the use of hand sanitizer after handling.  When I asked the waitress for recommendations she basically said everything on the menu was great (definitely hard to believe).  

As for the food, my husband ordered a margheritta pizza, which came out burnt to a crisp on one side but otherwise was fairly good.  I ordered the nachos, which were covered in burnt cheese, huge chunks of unripe tomatoes, a few black olives and half a carton of sour cream.  Both entrees looked very unappealing; I ate about four nachos before pushing the plate aside.  

Out of the entire disastrous evening, the service gets the prize for very worst.  After the food arrived we never saw our waitress again and waited twenty minutes for our check.  My husband finally had to get up to look for her and found her texting in the back.  We ended up not leaving a tip, a definite first for us.  

If your looking for a late night bite to eat, do yourself a favor and go across the street to Primanti Brothers.

A BOAT-load of beer! A hundred-some choices from light to dark and everything in between. Can't go wrong for beer. 

Depending on the time of day, a long wait may be awaiting you, although we had a table at first try this last time, at lunch-time on a Saturday. 

Food: ...alright, nothing to get too excited about. I remember it being better in the past. The choices are many but my wife could not find their famous 'going-cold-turkey' sandwich and they weren't willing to make this now-off-the-menu item either. 

We may go back, or not but our excitement is a little gone.
Too crowded.  The only thing I remember is the sweet potato fries.  Delicious.  But not worth the trip.

Stopped in around 1am for some pizza after a night out with the girls. It's not the best but their late night menu hit the spot. Back in college they used to have half priced nights. I got pizza and was able to substitute chicken. The staff was friendly and we got our food pretty fast.

A classic Oakland restaurant with a great atmosphere for a night out or a quiet dinner earlier. The beer selection is very thorough with a large selection of IPAs.

Recently I tried the alligator stew here and while it is good the place that fuel and fuddle really excels is their sandwiches.

A must for any students in the Oakland area with their late night special.

Great happy hour special (4pm-6pm and unadvertised, I believe) and the appetizers were all really tasty.  While the menu looks like typical bar food, our quesadillas were flavorful and packed with pork. During a mid-August afternoon, it wasn't too crowded till closer to 6, but that might change during the semesters. I'll still stop back and check it out though.

This place wasn't as good as we were expecting.  My pizza (Classic Maggie) was good, but nothing outstanding.  My husband's burger was completely charred and basically inedible.  We didn't bother sending it back as our waitress was nowhere to be found.

It's your typical bar food with a decent beer selection...nothing more, nothing less.

Fuel & Fuddle is the Lucy to my Charlie Brown.

I want to like the place.  I really do!  The atmosphere is relaxed and friendly.  The staff is nice (although the owners clearly subscribe to the "hire only the prettiest girls" theory of staffing, which is a little annoying).  And everything on the menu sounds delicious.

There!  That's why I don't like the place.  Everything sounds delicious.  SOUNDS.  Yet when the food arrives, it inevitably disappoints.  It's just not as good as it should be.

Part of the problem is the bread they use for the sandwiches, which tastes institutional and consistently underwhelms.  Several times I've had sandwiches there that would have been awesome, except they were on that lackluster, tasteless bread.

Positive things:  the beer selection is good.  The appetizers are passable.  I have no comment on the half-price food thing because half-price for mediocre food is still overpaying.

In summary, I want Fuel & Fuddle to be awesome.  But it simply isn't.

F&F is not a restaurant; it's a way of life.

I went to college in Pittsburgh, and there is NOTHING like F&F's half price Late Night experience. F&F is not the only place that does the half price Late Night thing, but it may as well be, for me.

After 11 pm every night, most of the menu is half price. You do have to get there early (10:30 ish on Fri/Sat/Sun) to put your name on the list, but for students, standing outside and chatting with your friends is part of the experience.

(Edited to add: Don't forget to tip on what your full bill would have been!)

My faves include the sweet potato fries, baked brie (!!!), Smashed Potato pizza, and turkey or buffalo burgers. I've heard they have amazing beers (but I don't drink) and I know they've got some fantastic desserts (my fave was the bread pudding which is gone now, but the brownie and apple turnover dishes are delish too).

They also have a surprisingly good brunch, and for the record, the basement is much less loud than the upstairs.

Every time I go back to Pittsburgh, I make sure F&F is on the agenda. Like I said, it's not just a restaurant.

Fuel & Fuddle is a nice option for lunch or dinner in Oakland.  They have a solid menu that ranges from specialty pizzas to a full out chicken dinner.  Lots of craft beers to choose from as well. 

Many menu items are cooked in a brick oven in the corner of the restaurant - from the pizzas to the crab cakes - so if you like that style this is your spot.  For pizza I think it is great, for items like the crab cakes, meh, not so much.  

Most meals are served with a mix of regular french fries and sweet potato fries.  The prices are a little more than what you'd pay for a typical lunch (plan on about $12-$15 for a meal and a soda) but worth it.

It gets crowded FAST and there is limited seating and a small bar.  Larger groups can sit in the basement which offers larger tables with bench seating.  

Staff here are attentive and friendly.
Our first dinner in Pittsburgh -- great burgers, pizza, and salads. Walked off dinner around Pitt. We would definitely come back and recommend it to others.

This is where I had my first sweet potato fries. The brick oven pizzas are great. The service is good. I had a friend drop half a quesadilla on the floor. We asked the waitress for some napkins. After she gave them to us, she came back with half of a quesadilla. They have some interesting beers. I'm not a beer guy, but you might be. I will return to this place.

The place is cozy with a nice atmosphere. Good selection of beers. 

Ordered a basic burger and fries. The fries were room temperature. The waitress did offer to replace them. The burger was juicy with good flavor. 

The waitress did say the pizza was their specialty.
The food is amazing. I've never had something I didn't like here. The wait staff is always really nice and quick. They also have a great selection of beer.

This place brings great memories to me :) Its a cute bar/restaurant place,and i guess its mostly filled with CMU kids and maybe Upitt.They have a good list of beers and i am a great fan of their food.
   Wait for it....The world's best fried called the "Waffle fries".It's just soo tatsy and out of the world.everything time i think of good food ,i still wonder if there is a place which makes waffle fries.This is the place where i first ate waffle fries and i am going back for that..pssst..i even wanted to make a trip to Pittsburgh just to eat them ;).And the last thing i wanted to do before leaving pittsburgh was...any guesses??
   Yes!!!eat waffle fries :)They are great!!but not healthy apparently.It's a great place to go hangout with a bunch of friends,and relax.Don't miss it !

-Smriti

Awesome restaurant and bar to go to with friends! The only reason I give it 4 stars is because parking can be hard to find (only street parking is available) and there isn't a great spot to stand and wait for a table to be ready (we have always had to wait for a table when we go.) The pizzas, pierogis, and buffalo chicken dip are awesome! And the beer menu is always changing and has some really great options on it! Highly suggest.

Good casual place to grab lunch or dinner! I got a burger and fries and it was great! The burger was huge and the fries were a mix of russet and sweet potato. The service was also great and everyone was very nice!

I miss Fuel like the
Desert misses the rain. No
Emo: just the truth*. 


*One of the best bloody marys in the WORLD

***They have changed the bloody mary mix and now it's like every other bloody mary
MANAGEMENT--- work this out***

I tried my first buffalo chicken pizza here 8 years ago when my parents were visiting me at PITT... and I've been hooked ever since. 

Loud and fun college atmosphere. This will always be one of my favorite restaurants to go to in Oakland.

This is one of my new favorite hangout joints. After 11pm, most of the food is half-off which is great.

I ordered:
'rollafatty' 
giant slices of pepperoni and mild cheddar cheese rolled in our made-from-scratch pizza dough and fired in the brick oven. served with house-made sicilian marinara $7.5

and

'the smashed potato' 
seasoned smashed potatoes, apple smoked bacon, mild cheddar, lettuce, tomatoes, and onions drizzled with house-made buttermilk dressing $8
add grilled rosemary chicken breast...add a buck! (Which i did and you should too!)

Now the RollaFatty is good, but the portion was too small to pay for it at full price. But the Smashed Potato was well worth it :)

I'd gladly go again :)

I am an out of town-er visiting the area, and stopped in here for a bite at lunch.  The food was good, the Chipotle Polka appetizer was very spicy but delicious.  I am not one to continue eating something if my mouth is burning, but those mini pierogies were tasty!  My sandwich was good, the veg head.  It wasn't anything overly special though.  I took a bite of my man's rosemary chicken sandwich and that was very good.  The best part, they give you half sweet potato fries half regular fries... you get the best of both worlds... the sweet potato fries were fried perfectly to a nice crispiness.  Not soggy at all and bursting with sweetness.  We went around 1:30 PM on a Monday and it wasn't to crowded.  The service was decent, the atmosphere was calm, and the prices were suitable for the amount of food you get (I still have 2/3 of my sandwich and half the fries in the fridge now).  Good place!

i can't remember if i really like the food here, except that I loved getting the mixed basket of idaho potato and sweet potato fries and the politically incorrect "irish car bomb."

more than anything they have a big room downstairs where i could come with 30+ folks and haggle over how to pay the bill, lofl.

Disguised as a wood stove restaurant, Fuel and Fuddle also serves as a beer lover's emporium. As an undergrad student at the University of Pittsburgh I often would head over to Fuel and Fuddle during the late night hours for its unique takes on classic American cuisine. But it wasn't until I took a seat at the small bar in the corner that I realized I was in a place that was so much more than just a good place to eat.

The beer selection is amazing, literally hundreds of brews to choose from including pale ales, porters, IPAs, stouts, you name it and Fuel and Fuddle has it. On the wall behind the bar hangs the names of people who have at least tried 100 different beers. I even saw a plaque celebrating a patron who tried 1000 different beers. Count that. 1000 beers. That's pretty impressive.

Around ten beers are on tap, each one is a different style giving the beer lover a great number of options to choose from. If the draft beers don't fancy your tastes then you'll surely find a beer you love in the selection of over 500 bottled beers in stock.

For its selection of unique beers, Fuel and Fuddle's prices are varied. Draft domestics are as cheap as $2.00, but some of the rare micro-brews and import bottles can be upwards of $10, so if you are drinking on a budget it might be in your interest to check the price with the bartender before you order.

If you are looking for rowdy drunken foolery Fuel and Fuddle is not your place. The bar area is entirely too small for anything than merely drinking. Furthermore, if you are trying to find a place to watch a game Fuel and Fuddle isn't really suited for that either. The TV's are small and positioned at awkward angles coupled with the noise level from the restaurant makes it impossible to hear any of the commentary.

Fuel and Fuddle is best suited as a kick off to a night or a place to get a couple drinks after dinner. For a beer lover, the selection is unmatched anywhere in Oakland and can compete with any place in the city. For it's beer selection I recommend this bar to beer-lovers passing through Oakland.

An impressive beer selection and purely average bar food round out Fuel and Fuddle's offerings.  Most dining options--from burgers to brunch--cap out at mediocre.  But with a hundred beers to choose from, this place still earns three stars.  If you're not up for drinking, however, you can find much better options.

This is definitely a college student geared restaurant. So if you like that kind of environment then yes, this is the place for you.  

I personally wasn't impressed by the waitstaff, atmosphere, or the food for that matter. I had the portobello mushroom sandwich and asked myself what it was.  The sandwich had nothing of substance besides the huge roll of bread it came on. I took off the singular shriveled piece of lettuce that came with the blackened burger and ate my sweet potato fries instead.  
Now, that is something that you should go for! The sweet potato fries are perfectly crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. They aren't dripping with oil like other places so I don't feel like a total glutton. 

I remember coming here my freshman year for their half off and ordering their famous mashed potato pizza.  It was a good time, I tried ordering it again when my friend invited me for dinner and couldn't finish the darn thing.

I came here this past Saturday after the Pitt vs. SBU game for a bite to eat. I hadn't actually eaten here in quite some time and I ended up being pleasantly surprised with the food being tasty as I remembered it being. We got there right before the big after game rush so we were able to snag a booth. I didn't catch our server's name but it took us (and I'm not exaggerating) 15 minutes to get our first drinks. They were drafts so it's not like anything needed to be done except pouring them in glasses for us. The draft list was  not what i remember it being. They had maybe 10 to choose from however, they were all from 2 breweries. I'd have liked to see a bit more variety since that is what I always remember them being known for-their beer selection. After we finally got our first drinks we put in an appetizer, the fire baked brie. The brie was baked in their pizza oven wrapped in dough and served with caramel drizzle and apple slices. The taste was very good-oozey,cheesy,gooey-exactly what you'd want it to be. I think they should serve it either with more apple slices or some type of crostini or crackers. For entrees, my boyfriend and I decided to order 2 pizzas and split them amongst the two of us plus his friend that ended up joining us. We ordered the flying buffalo (Fresh Mozzarella with Grilled Rosemary Chicken & Celery Tossed in Our Scratch-Made Buffalo Sauce Finished with Crumbled Bleu Cheese) and the slaughterhouse (Housemade Tomato Sauce, Fresh Mozzarella, Giant Pepperoni Slices,Crumbled Italian Sausage and Apple Smoked Bacon). Each was around $9 and was an 8 cut pie. The flying buffalo was my favorite. The sauce was not overly hot and it blended nicely with the blue cheese. I only sampled one slice of the slaughterhouse and it was basically a loaded meat pizza. It was pretty good however the crust was pretty burned. The friend joining us ordered the chipotle polka (Mini Potato & Cheese Stuffed Pierogies Smothered with Sweet Onions,
Bacon and Smoked Jalapeos in Adobo Sauce. Topped with Sour Cream,Cheddar & Monterey Jack Cheeses) He had a lot to take home but he said they were pretty good. I'm not a pierogie  fan so I can't attest to his review since I did not try them myself. overall Fuel and Fuddle is still a good place to go in Oakland, just be able to tolerate extremely slow service and possibly having to wait for a table if there is an event and you don't arrive before the rush.

Pretty good food, reasonably priced. Was better when they ran their half off specials after 11pm before renovation, though. Their fries, especially the sweet potato ones, are delish! Can't go wrong with their fire pies (pizzas) either. The Big Azz brownie, literally a brick of chocolate with ice cream, is one of the most sinful things I've had. An Oakland Classic, I would recommend everyone try it at least once!
Cool little place hidden away in Oakland.  Great place for a few drinks and apps.  If your a vegiterian this is a great spot.
Ordered Pirogies today...soooo good. Also ordered a Penn Pilsner...also very good. Excellent service. When I visit my son at Carlow Univ...will definitely come here again!

It's basically a loud, dimly-lit sports bar that serves cheap, greasy 1/2 finger food after 11pm. Nothing really stood out and, again, the food was really greasy. 

Meh. Go if you have midnight munchies and you want cheap food.

This was a classic all throughout undergrad especially freshman and sophomore year. I went here for late night food every week in my earlier years and once a month later on in undergrad. 

I always ordered the skinny dip (buffalo chicken dip) which never disappointed and also got the funnel of love which is a really delicious funnel cake. 

I started regularly ordering the pierogies as well which quickly became a favorite of mine. I think I have such positive opinions of this place because I associate it with such fond memories of undergrad.
Had salad one day for lunch while visiting Pittsburgh. Decent enough and the vegetables were fresh, but waaaayy too much dressing (get it on the side). If it's cold, try the chili.
Overrated, bad spot to eat. Their nachos were horrible and complete waste of 10 bucks

Very laid back environment and reliable service! We came on a Saturday afternoon for drinks and appetizers, and sat at the bar. The bartender was attentive but not overbearing and got us our drinks pretty fast. Their beer list is laid out by type - very helpful! We got the Rollafatty appetizer - delicious! I'd come back here if I lived in the area.

Traveling on business.  Until tonight I didn't have a reason to return to Pittsburgh.  BYO burger was great, when I asked for my fries crispy the waitress told me I would get both regular fries and sweet potato fries (my wife loves them, me not so much) I hesitate and just go with it.  The huge plate of food came and I tried the regular fry first as always to confirm crispy, good, then a sweet potato fry, AWESOME.  I have never had a sweet potato fry that was even close to crispy and these were not only crispy but tasted great.

Came here for beer with the co-residents after giving a physics lecture earlier in the day.  

Food (7.5/10) = Got the meatball pizza.  Definitely enjoyed the thin crust pizza.  But getting to business, I came here to chill with friends and for beer.  Fuel and Fuddle has a great beer selection.  What surprised me, was that they carried Abita, which is something I haven't seen since leaving Louisiana two years ago.  Great beer, indeed.  Happy hour is from 16:00-18:00. 

Ambiance (7.5/10) = Didn't really pay attention to the place actually.  Was just enjoying the beer and hanging with the co-res.  

Service (8.5/10) = Our waitress was great and attentive.  Checked on our table frequently to see if we needed anything, but not at the high frequency of being annoying.  

Overall opinion = will come back to this place for sure for the next 4 years to decompress with their great beer selection.  I only wish that they extend their happy hours to 19:00.

We were in Oakland today around lunch time. I checked the places I had bookmarked for the area. Fuel and Fuddle was across the street from where we were shopping. We walked in and loved the decor and set up of the place. 
Our server was very nice. She answered our questions and quickly got our drinks. My husband ordered the Moby Dick sandwich and I ordered the Chicken Pesto pizza. 
The Moby Dick is a fish sandwich. The piece of fish is 3 times the size of the bun. It's fried in a great southern style coating. It's not the type of batter you find on Pittsburgh fish sandwiches-thick and greasy. There is also coleslaw on the sandwich. It tastes good and gives a great crunch. The best part (besides the coating) is the tarter sauce. We are pretty sure it is house made. It's the best tarter sauce I've ever had. It was thick and creamy and had great flavor. The sandwich is served with a mix of regular fries and sweet potato fries. 
My pizza was the size of a dinner plate. It has a thin crust and is baked in a brick oven. It had a base of olive oil, followed by a layer of pesto. Then it was topped with a creamy cheese, pieces of grilled chicken and tomatoes. One bite and I was hooked. I liked the thin crust and the crispy edges. 
We enjoyed our dining experience from start to finish. We we go back soon and take our friends.

Hit this place while in town for the Memorial Day weekend.  Dropped in for lunch on a rainy Sunday, while visiting the Pitt campus.

The burgers stood out on the menu, even though there looked like plenty of interesting entree's, but many of them seemed more like dinner...

Ordered the Hangover burger.  I'm always a sucker for a bacon and egg burger.  Burger was fantastic, cooked a bit more than the med-rare, but close enough.

The side was a half and half mix of sweet potato and regular fries, the sweet potato fries looked like they had been sitting for too long, a bit shriveled and fairly chewy.  The other fries were great.  

I didn't order any beer or cocktails, but looked like a great selection of beer.

Dropped a star because of the fries.  Overall a good experience, would give them another chance.

If you're a beer lover, then you will LOVE this place. Not only is their beer selective expansive, it is also top notch. Just about every time I visit I order something new to try with the help of their knowledgeable bartenders. 

It's dark and gives off a bit of a moody feel, but that is awesome when it is crazy hot outside and you're trying to escape the sun's death rays. So far the food has been sort of hit-or-miss for me. The first time I visited, even though I was definitely having a good time, I ordered a pulled pork sandwich and took about two bites. It was terrible. Even the waitress admitted that it definitely was not one she liked, and she was nice enough to take it off the bill for me, though I did not ask. 

Their meatloaf is killer, and I highly recommend ordering it with a side of sweet potato fries. In fact, if you aren't very hungry you should order a half-and-half mix of their regular and sweet potato fries. The fries are soooo good here. I wonder how many times I can put fries into this one paragraph ...

I have also had a few of their pizzas and only had one bad experience: their margherita pizza. I'm pretty sure it was just the cook that particular visit, but it was just awful. Not just flavor-wise, though it was more of a cheese pizza than a margherita. I picked up a slice and all of my toppings fell through the back. No joke. The bottom of the entire pizza was so soggy, it couldn't hold together. Which also makes for an unpleasant experience in your mouth, in case you were unaware.

All in all, I would recommend a visit to Fuel & Fuddle if you are in the area. Be careful in regards to parking - finding a space on the street is usually impossible and a quarter will only get you 7 & 1/2 minutes in the meter.

Nachos = heap of chips with mild cheddar, canned black olives and a few slices of jalapeo that had been microwaved into a rubbery, tasteless mess. Black bean and quinoa burger = bland, cold, gray patty of mush served on a stale roll. Avoid.

This is one of the few locations in Oakland that, at the very least appears, to be able to pass a sanitation inspection in my native county. The cleanliness along with upbeat college environment makes it a spot that I enjoy going to eat at as opposed to ordering takeout.

Fuel & Fuddle also has a wide selection of beers and has some pretty sweet late night deals (I think half off). The menu is also quite extensive featuring a mix of finger and utensil food. The quality of the items does seems to be consistent as I've been satisfied with all the entrees that I've tried so far with my favorite being the fish sandwich.

Would give this place negative stars if possible. Horrible service. Drink we're so bad we sent them back. Buffalo chicken dip was disgusting - how can you mess that up? Burger came out cold. Awful service, even worse food. Never again.

If your looking for a collage town hang out look no more. It's small and the tables cramp you together so it has a intimate vibe. It has a large selection of beers and liquor. Definitely guaranteed to satisfy the picky ones. The food is awesome there's so many good choices it's hard to go wrong. I am personally a huge fan of there sweet potato fries I don't know what's different from there's to others but it's so hard to stop eating them. Today I decided to try the flying buffalo pizza. I am so happy I did because it was so delicious it all paired together so well. The dough was thin crust but had such a full flavor. The chicken was packed perfectly with flavor notes of the rosemary. The scratch made buffalo sauce was beautiful not to spicy or overwhelming flavor. It all blended together so well I was so pleased. I had to get some to go being I couldn't finish it all because the portions are large. I will definitely be returning here in the near future.

2 words: Late Night! I've always been for their late night special which is half off the menu. Fuel is your quintessential cheap late night food that gets the job done (burgers, wings, fries). 

This time I ordered the chicken quesadilla with smashed potatoes and sweet potato fries. I was pretty disappointed by the chicken quesadilla. It was bland and had very little chicken and filling. The sweet potato fries, although not the best I've had, and the smashed potatoes were satisfying! All sides were $3

Great for large groups. Very casual, college environment (in the heart of Pitt's campus)

Flavor explosion! I love the food here, there is nothing on the menu that isn't completely delicious! Food of this quality is really the exception rather than the rule in an area so close to a big school as I've learned.

But the service has always been slow when I've visited and the place is always loud, even when you're in for lunch and the place is almost deserted--though if you're in it to really enjoy the food, that's when you want to go.

We were in the Burgh for a mini vacation, ok there on business to see King Diamond! However, we were scared that the place would be a ghost town,past 11:00.
We were happily wrong. We stumbled into this place, after a tedious drive, and chowed down on some great grub. 

No qualms with the food, the party of 6 was happy! That is a rare occurrence!

Oh I had a $6.00 dinner, since I got a side salad, a side of veg, and a side of fries. All were satisfactory, and yummy.

A great gastro pub in the University area. Although it was very loud inside and the service wasnt anything to write home about, its a great place to grab a burger or a beer (which they have plenty of-- phenomenal craft beer and draft list!). If you're coming here, be sure to make room for the regular fries AND sweet potato fries that come with your meal-- yum. I got the Rosemary's Breast sandwich and it was pretty unique-- very filling as well.

Neat, bar-ish atmosphere but with a local feel. Great beer selection, I was very impressed. The food was very good as well. Thanks for not steering me wrong fellow yelpers! I probably would have passed over this place were it not for the great ratings! I'd come back!

If you're in Oakland with friends who are divided on drinking vs. eating, Fuel and Fuddle is a good compromise: big beer selection to satisfy the drinkers, and plenty of food options to keep the eaters happy.

The portions here are really generous.  While not listed directly on the menu, you can request a side of just sweet potato fries (instead of the mix of regular and sweet potato fries), and the plate you get is huge.  The pizzas here are pretty good, with thin crusts that are nicely chewy.  The dessert portions here are the largest I've ever seen--the brownie is about three or four times larger than the typical bar brownie and the nutter butter pie is the tallest peanut butter pie I've seen.  I like how Fuel and Fuddle tried to put its own twist on the apple turnover with the apple "burnover" by using pizza dough instead of puff pastry.  The dough itself, however, could have been more sweet--even with warm apple filling inside, the chocolate sauce drizzled on top, and the vanilla ice cream, I felt the dessert lacked something.

As other reviewers have said, this isn't a place to go to if you want to have conversations.  In a party of six, I had to stick to talking to the people right next to me, and even then I felt like I was nearly shouting.  The food and drinks here aren't bad at all, but not quite enough to convince me to frequent this place if I'm not already in Oakland.

I don't know if the waitress was having a bad day, but it turned into a uncomfortable experience.

Normally I like to order a byo burger, with ground beef and all the free toppings. But when I told the waitress this usual order, she repeated my order with a slow incredulous blink and unnecessary tone, "All the toppings?" "Yes, all of them. I like them." And she continues to repeat this two more times, and me having to confirm this. I haven't had a problem with this order before, and it doesn't list that there is a limit to the number of toppings. I couldn't understand the difficulty in why she had to repeat this more than twice and I had to reconfirm this more than twice. Is she judging me? I didn't understand. 

Still confused as to why I have to repeat myself four times, I go on to say that I have ordered this byo burger before several times, and there weren't any issues with the previous orders -- the waitstaff took my order without a problem and the burger came out fine (really good) in the past. Then she says as if I WAS A LIAR and said, "Ok but I don't know if it'll all fit." 

Burger came, burnt sweet potato fries. I really don't trust this meal.

Thanks, I'll go elsewhere.

Excellent sweet potato fries and really nice beer selection. However the food and service lacks consistency. The first time i dined here I ordered a type of pulled pork sandwich. Alas it arrived blackened beyond recognition and my friends complained about the way it smelled. And don't get me wrong i love a good bonfire and the scent of charcoal just as much as any girl, but not so much when it's on my plate. After that experience I've mostly stuck to ordered sweet potato fries and the pizzas. During another instance my friend and i waited an hour for our food. upon finally flagging down the waitress she revealed our order had been burnt and the chefs forgot to recook it. (I knew I smelled something burning!!) we only had to wait about 15 minutes for them to redo our order....but when they brought it to us it was the completely wrong dish. The waitress was very apologetic and handle the situation very well. And we didnt pay for our food. Apart from that the experience has either been hit or miss. Some days the pizza is spot on. Others days the crust is a charbroiled and shriveled husk. I must say I do love half off the menu after 11pm.

Food was meh...service was decent. Torn between a 2-3...opted for two since I couldnt even finish my meal.

If youre int he area and looking for a late night bite...try mad mex's instead.

The food is pretty good! I've been here a couple of times and ordered different things. The menu is vast so really all and any kind of American food can be found! The pulled pork sandwich was scrumptious and the wings were well done! I also found Angry Orchard Hop'n Mad Apple cider here, and it's the greatest drink in the world! Best cider I've had in the States! Good on ya for having his delicious bottle around, Fuel and Fuddle!

Great beer selection, outstanding menu, good service. It's easy to see why it's so popular. A really fun place. I ordered a meatloaf sandwich, my friend ordered a Caesar salad, both were wonderful. An ever hanging draft list on a blackboard will have you coming back. Small and loud is part of the charm. Fun, fun, fun!

Such a fun, unique place! The food is definitely filled with deliciousness. Some are good for you choices, some truly indulgent American classics but with a funky with a twist.  My favorite meal is the flying buffalo pizza and sweet potato fires. Their homemade ranch dressing is truly the bet ranch I've ever had. Its thin and salty.  
Fuel and Fuddle is located on Pitt's campus so make sure you check the basketball schedule before planning a visit.
Good food and relatively inexpensive. Good beer selection and good service.  I had the pulled pork bbq sandwich. Very good!
One of the nicest Burgers in the Oakland area. At least among those I have tried. They also have a wide veriety of beers that you can try.

I've never gone to F&F for late-night, which is when the line can stretch out the door. However, the lunch menu is reasonably priced and the pizzas are amazing - some of my favorite anywhere.

Also, F&F has a wide selection of beer, and even has a beer bible where you can fill out the beers you've tried.
Everything is great here food wise. Their pizza is excellent, and their nachos are great too! The service isn't the best, and if the hostess has friends at the door she might seat them before you.

I've gone here for lunch two times, and each time, I've gotten a sandwich and fries (mixed russet and sweet potatoes). Both times, I was happy with what I ordered. It's all quality stuff, but speaking as a "poor grad student," the value for your money isn't as good as it would be at some of the other restaurants in the area.

I think I've only gone once during non-half-off hours in my four years in Pittsburgh because my general opinion of Fuel & Fuddle is meh.  It's meh as in nothing to wow me, but not at all a bad-meh as I have gone pretty frequently during half-off hours.  Located right off of Pitt campus, you really can't beat a decent $5 meal.  For half-off on most nights, do expect to wait 15 minutes for a table and 30 minutes for your plate.

The food is okay.  It's basically average all-American food, although some dishes just aren't well made.  I remember I once ordered a salad dish with guacamole...couldn't finish it because I couldn't ask for water refill fast enough to wash down the over-abundance of flavor...  Then there was a chicken wrap that featured really charred chicken pieces that didn't taste too great and was WAAY too salty.  BUT I know that the potato fries are pretty good and some of their weird pizzas are pretty tasty...  Also, most plates have a good amount of food.  Yay American sizing =)

Overall, I recommend it especially if you're in college.  It has a college atmosphere and helps you stay on a budget.  And really, the food is SOLID to GOOD.

It was alright, but at least the sweet potato fries were good.

Fuel and Fuddle is your typical casual, late-night dining spot that prides itself on their pizza, burgers, and other bar food. The Havana Burger and quesadilla were good, but not great. I might come back for their cheaper late night menu (11PM - 1AM everyday) but the food was definitely not worth the regular price for me. 

The highlight of my experience was the sweet potato fries that came with my burger.

Came here a few times and it's always more fun in the night. I came here for lunch with colleagues one time and it was decently crowded. We were able to get a table without any hassles which was great. Everyone in my group enjoyed Their food and the we ice was good too. I ordered a salad and it was food as well. Portions are quite large, so be prepared for that. It's decently priced.

One of my favorite items is their dessert pie which is like a giant cookie filled chocolate which was absolutely delicious. It's quite heavy though, so I'd recommend sharing that.

I loved this place: amazing pizzas, great drinks, good atmosphere. Until I experienced an incident involving a mouse. We had paid our bill and were just waiting to leave when a mouse suddenly scurried across the window sill above our booth and across to where my friends were sitting. We all flew up and out of the booth in reaction to this. Our waitress came over to ask what happened and we told her. Her reaction was slow. She casually walked back to get the manager. All he did was say he was sorry. No refund or anything was offered and I felt like I was being interrogated to find out where the mouse was. This was the worst experience ever at what used to be one of my favorite places to go and I will never return.

I have had food here about 3 times now. Once at the restaurant and twice I have ordered from Grubhub. I've had the wings, Cajun steak and shrimp dinner, meatloaf, and beer mussels. All of them were so delicious and my Grubhub delivery was fast and fresh! It came from Oakland to Lawrenceville in about 45 minutes. My chef friend introduced me to this spot and it's always great.

Fuel & Fuddle strikes me as one of those establishments that stirs sentimental feelings from patrons who were regular visitors during their college days in Pittsburgh. 

Either that or it's the funky, brick-walled, logo-laden atmosphere. 

I'm all about the food, ya peanuts, and aside from a rather accomplished pizza, I came away unimpressed. 

Kay, myself, and I friend who lives in the vicinity were to catch a concert ('Again?' I hear you groan...) at the Petersen Events Center and of course needed that pre-show bite to carry us through the proceedings. After having remembered that a fellow Yelper or two has mentioned that F&F is a favorite dining spot of theirs, I thought we might be in for some good grubbin'. 

As I wrote earlier, I did savor our crudely named C'mon Iwana Leya Hawaiian Pizza. Succulent, lightly brackish grilled ham played off the juicy, caramelized pineapple like accomplished twin guitarists, the stage being a thin crust that was akin to a dusty, toasted pita with its union of chew, crispness, and char. Fresh, silken mozzarella blanketed the affair while a house-made bourbon-infused BBQ sauce brought richly sweet, intoxicating undertones. Dark Paradise would have been a more fitting title for this gripping story of a pizza/appetizer. 

I came very close to ordering the Alligator Stew, but its description conjured images of me not finishing what read like a Shepherd's Pie that might have been stingy with the armored lizard in question. Translation: I thought it might be too filling and lacking in gator.  Nah, I wanted something a little lighter. 

So whaddya know? I went with a Havana Burger. 

And I began to wish I'd been more adventurous. 

I like Cuban sandwiches, and I am obsessed with burgers, so it stood to reason that I should have been pleased with this handheld hybrid.  Instead, aside from the above average regular and sweet potato fries (a helping of each is apparently included with each burger), the overall entree left me chilly, especially when one considers F&F's chuck, sirloin, and brisket blend. Yet that 1/2 pound patty, ordered medium-rare, was cooked medium, creating dryness where there should not have been. Crud, Eat 'N Park's Superburger is juicer than this was. Also unforgivably arid were the ham and pulled pork. Provolone and dill pickle chips had marginal involvement as did whole grain mustard and roasted garlic mayo, which were plopped in the center of the burger itself without being spread about. While not a deplorable burger, it wasn't worth the boat ride from Miami, know what I mean?

Dessert was a toss-up between the Sweet Potato Cheesecake, Nutter Butter Pie, and The Big Ass Brownie. F&F doesn't make the cheesecake in-house, so that was quickly dismissed even if it's probably very good (I'll go to Enrico Biscotti Co, if I want to try it). The Nutter Butter Pie was promising, but once more trepidation caused me to order the brownie. My readers will know that hot fudge brownie sundaes are arguably my preferred dessert over them all, but this one was not nearly as "gooey" as F&F states on the menu. Old "Big-Ass" was more like a large cube of warm chocolate cake topped with walnuts, chocolate syrup, caramel, and vanilla ice cream with some raspberry (?) puree acting as a clever, artistic garnish (see my photo). Moderately tasty it was even if the cake (this was no brownie) wasn't as moist as I would have liked. Still, I craved something fudgy, something dense, something dripping with molten ooze. It wasn't to be. 

Nonetheless, the service was fine, and environs were welcoming enough. Perhaps my ordering instincts shorted out when I came here. Restaurants with many fetching options sometimes do that to me.

This is by far my favorite restaurant in the area!
The servers are always pleasant and quick. The food always comes hot. The beer comes cold. 
Their menu is entertaining and there's something for everyone.
My favorite is the Grilled Psychedelic sandwich. It's a portobello mushroom sandwich and is always very good. Their wings are great too! And they also have the option of getting sweet potato fries with your food!
The atmosphere is spectacular - always fun and lively - and after 11:00 P.M. the food is half price! 
I really do love this place.

When visiting Pittsburgh for the first time, some locals directed us to try this place and we're glad they did...having now lived here for a little over a year it remains one of our favorite hangouts in the city and given its Oakland location makes an excellent walkable destination for college folks looking for something a step up from Hemingway's and the like (without a step up in price).

When you step in, there's always a fun message on the chalkboard usually making fun of something to do with chain restaurants or horrible NASCAR style beers...neither of which have any connection to the fare or beverage selections here.  There's a dizzying selection of bottled brews on the menu, but attention draft fans the larger chalkboard inside the place is what you want to be looking at.  There are always a dozen or more interesting worthwhile selections up there and if you're stuck for suggestions, there's an employee favorite listed at the bottom.

The food is delicious and portions are ample, most of the time if we don't split an entree we end up with leftovers (never a bad thing!).  I don't think we've ever tried a dessert but we've had most of the salads and sandwiches and several of the entrees and never a disappointment among them (also, there are a bunch of unique pizza options though we've never really been into pub pizza, preferring the big floppy NYC stuff).

Favorites include the buffalo burger, turkey burger, meatloaf sandwich, and the salad with the candied walnuts and avocados...thought you probably can't go wrong with anything they serve.

Finally, in Oakland tradition, late at night most of the food (see menu for details) becomes half-off for those on restrictive budgets (or those who would just prefer to preserve more dollars for the aforementioned draft selections).

If you're in the Pitt/CMU area and looking for something with more variety and better sit-down atmosphere than Primanti's or the "O" definitely surf over to their web site and see if the menu catches your fancy!

Quite possibly my favorite place in the entire United States. It's unfortunate it has to be in Pittsburgh, PA...but that's part of what makes it awesome in it's own way. I am giving this place the honor of my very first Yelp review even though I have not lived in Pittsburgh for more than a year.

This place has amazing American pub food. The nachos are piled high with an indeterminable amount of good toppings. The buffalo wings (and other kinds of wings) are large, properly covered in sauce, and perfectly spicy. But the best food here are the pizzas. The Flying Buffalo, the Garden of Eden, et. al. No matter what mood you are in, there's an awesome personal pizza to be had.

As if the food wasn't enough, they have probably the best (not the largest - the best) beer selection in Pittsburgh. House brews and Great Lakes (from Cleveland), Guinness, Yeungling, all on tap. More than 50 others in bottles. At decent prices too!

Almost all food is half-off after 11PM every night - which is key.

On Saturdays, the "house blues man" Don Sjzeck, plays his awesome mix of Johnny Cash, Greatful Dead, blues, and rock covers as well as his fun sing-along original stuff. It made every Saturday night awesome for me.

Hangover Breakfast on Sunday mornings is great for its stated purpose. Unlimited coffee, bloody marys, etc.

Do what you need to do and go there one night. It's worth it and its an awesome Pittsburgh experience.

The plan: Get there by 10:45 to beat the half off food crowd that gets there at 11PM. Order some beers and wait for a table. They usually have specials going on. Sit down by 11 and order some food at half off. Except diner waffle fries they are NOT half off. 

I think these people own Joe Mama's two doors down. 

Vegtarian: Portablello burger with sweet potato fries and ying yang rolls! yum!

So sad that their late night menu is now $6 instead of $5. However, their chipotle polka pierogies are still worth it. The pierogies are filled with potato and cheese and then cooked in a spicy chipotle sauce. The caramelized onions, sour cream, cheddar, and bacon elevate these from just normal pierogies to a cheesy delightful explosion in your mouth.

This was the first time I'd ever set foot in Fuel & Fuddle, being of the 'older' generation, who tends to steer clear of college haunts...but I'd had their food before, compliments of Wheel Deliver, in the non-20-something safety of my home. 

The food that I'd had had frankly been somewhat impressive, even for delivery, which I'm discovering in da burgh, tends to lean toward the 'let's skimp a bit' side. It was last summer, so I can't remember everything we'd ordered, but I do recall a pasta dish with seafood that was actually a healthy portion, as well as very creamy and tasty, with some nice plump shrimp.

So this past weekend, with an old high school friend in from out of town, after already having eaten a big lunch, then sitting through a movie, we were peckish at the dinner hour. We initially wanted to try the Conflict Kitchen, but they were closed on a Sunday for the dinner hour, so we drove a few blocks over and started to hunt, and I thought 'Hey, let's give Fuel & Fuddle a physical try!'.

We were met at the door by an absolutely delightful young gal named 'Morgan', who was not only greeting us at the door, but she was actually there to OPEN the door for us. She took us to a table, gave us our menus, and returned in mere moments to take our drink order - Coke products - thank GOODNESS - our lunch choice, a Mexican restaurant, only had Pepsi (or Pessi, as they put it) products, and by dinner I was seriously Jonesing for a DC. Morgan assured me that she'd keep the glass full and she did.

Since we weren't up for a full meal, the decision was made by my friend, after minimal suggestion, that dinner needed to be WINGS and CHOCOLATE. So we split an order of Garlic Parmesan wings, and then split a Big Assed Brownie. 

The wings were very good, plump and juicy and flavorful, served with Ranch Dressing, and the ten of them sated our small appetites just fine. 

However, Morgan was a trooper, and the kitchen was extremely accommodating when I asked a special favor. When we'd ordered for delivery, I had been dying of curiosity about their Alligator Stew. I'd had my Gator Bites when living in Florida, but had never had gator meat in a stew. Every time we ordered, they ended up being out of the stew, so I'd never gotten to try it. Now, we were in no position to devour a full meal, but I still wanted to try it. So I asked if they might be willing to part with just a sample for future reference, IF they had any. Morgan checked, and the kitchen obliged with a small bowl of the mashed potatoes covered with a small sampling of the gator stew. It also has chicken and sausage in it, but they were easily recognized. The gator was tender and flavorful as well. Morgan said she'd never try it. I may have convinced her to step out of the black and gold box and take one bite...to expand her horizons. The stew really is very good. And come on...like everything else that people think is too weird to try...tastes like chicken. Well, ok, not really. It tastes more like pork with the texture of soft ground beef.

Next up came the dessert. Cindy ate the one of the brownies and a few bites of the ice cream, and took the second brownie home, and I just picked at the ice cream. It was perfectly fine for what it was. A big assed brownie with ice cream, walnuts and chocolate sauce. 

The crowd WAS very young, and had it been packed with this age group, I probably would have opted to move on, but being that it was summer and a Sunday, it was not packed, and therefor tolerable.

Morgan thanked us profusely for being so nice, to the point that I can only imagine what she might go through with her 'regular' crowd. And that would be the crowd I'd try to avoid.

But for an off-season evening, it was a very pleasant experience. The food was good, the atmosphere pleasant, the service perfect, and the price was decent.

And they definitely have a few variations on the menu that I'd like to go back and try when I'm up for an actual dinner.

There was no Fuddle, but plenty of Fuel.

Good job, and thank you Morgan.

Most of my visits to Fuel and Fuddle were for their late night menu, which in my recollection begins at 11pm. There's always a line out the door before then so be ready to wait. I loved their big wood-fired oven. The pizzas are really tasty (smoking hen, the naked truth, and the smashed potato pizzas are must try's!). Try their big ass brownie sundae, but be sure to share it with a friend because you won't be able to finish it alone.

Well said Jessica W. 

I also want to put a special note in about the waffle fries, more specifically, the awesome sauce that comes with them that is completely addicting. I have had generally good experiences with fuel and fuddle, however, my dessert spoon tasted of green onions the last time I was there. Strange combo with peanut butter pie. But definitely good bar food.

Excellent! I ordered through grubhub and the food arrived hot and quick. The pierogies are so good! You can never go wrong with cheese and bacon. My burger could have been seasoned a bit more but other than that it was pretty good too. I would definitely recommend this place.

They deserve 25 stars. I stumbled into the place on my lunch break and it is beautiful. I had no idea the food was sooooo brilliant and good. I had the cheese burger and fries. I literally wanted to sleep on the floor after i ate. yummmy!!!

We were looking for a place to go for my 21st birthday. This was not my first choice after looking at bars on yelp. But after going here, I wouldn't have wanted to go anywhere else. We didn't want to go to a dive bar, it needed to be open past 12 and we needed to be able to order food. This place checked off all of our boxes. The place was cool, small, had high ceilings, decorations on the walls, and felt warm- aesthetically. Our waitress was really good. She served me my first legal drink. The prices were really good. We were there at a time that the late night menu was available, so food was cheaper. As a college student, who does not attend Pitt, it was still really cool to be there and be around younger people. I got a blackened chicken wrap and it was so so good.  I didn't even get a picture of it, because after my first bite, I wanted to eat the whole thing. I also got fries with it and they said that they could give me sweet potato and regular fries, which changed the whole experience for me. I thought that was really cool, because I love both fries. We got chicken wings too, they were really good. Everyone I was with was happy too. They offered bottles and tap and they had so many whiskey and bourbon choices which was really cool. The menu was cool because it explained the differences between whiskey and bourbon which was cool to read. Would return - happily.
I ordered delivery a few months ago. Their sandwich and fries were good but the pizza was COMPLETELY BURNT TO THE PINT WHERE IT WAS INEDIBLE.

I had heard a lot of good things about fuel and fuddle so I was pretty excited to dine here, but I was a little let down.  We were crammed at a tiny table between two other tables where we were stuck listening to the surrounding conversations.  The service and food were decent, nothing special...except for the fire baked Brie, that was awesome!  Maybe our experience was just "okay" because we were here for dinner when it was packed, we didn't drink, and we made bad entree choices?  I might try this place for lunch or late night some time and see if my feelings change.

Just came back from lunch with a friend. She ordered the special Big Ass Fish Sandwich, which was indeed huge. I got the Veggie & Hummus Phat Wrap--also a lot of food. Overall, very serviceable, my skirt wasn't blown-up but it's a good place to get good food that's not expensive. I will say when I asked for the other half of my wrap to be boxed up the waitress came back with a box for me to do so, which in general I'm not a fan of.  But here, where the space is a bit tight it's kind of awkward to have to box your own food.

Fuel and Fuddle has my favorite wings of all time. I love the hottest ones! I eat lots of spicy food, and these are the only that are both tasty and spicy. Great beer selection. I love the alligator stew and waffle fries, especially. 

Only problems with F&F is how crowded it gets, how loud it gets, and that it's in Pittsburgh!

I used to come here five years ago when I was in college and I had a lot of great memories. The food was never extraordinary but they had a few good dishes. However, I went back recently and was extremely disappointed. I had been looking forward to their jerk chicken wings and they are now using a new sauce that doesn't have nearly as good of definition or flavor. They brought all of our food out at once (appetizers, soup, salads, main dishes) and some of it was cold. This happened because our waitress was sweeping the floor for ten minutes when our food was up. Generally the only items we had that were good was the house salad and the sweet potato fries. The chicken chili had potential but it was barely warm. To boot the restaurant was not very clean when we were there. The bathroom smelled, both toilets were clogged, and there was no toilet paper. All in all, I had high expectations and was disappointed.
Service was good. Attentive and polite staff. However, the food was low quality, very salty, and uninspired.

Absolutely AWESOME place to go for late night. Bar is great, and the menu for late night is fantastic. They literally have everything that you can imagine...I always get the psychedelic wrap with the portabella mushrooms. Wish that the fries were half off at late night too. The only reason I'm not giving them 5 stars is because the wait is impossibly long at night...wish they were better with moving people along.

As a Pitt alum, Fuel and Fuddle is by far my favorite place to eat in Pittsburgh.

1. Fuel's late-night (11pm-1am) $5 menu is unbeatable. After a long night studying or at the end of a fun weekend, Fuel is the best place to go with friends.

2. Everyone finds something addicting to order at Fuel (many people more than 1). The burgers, pizzas, sandwiches, appetizers, and - surprisingly - SALADS are all addicting in different ways, and the main struggle ordering is deciding between all of your favorite dishes. I always end up ordering the Skinny Dip (buffalo chicken dip), but I also love the Smashed Potato Pizza, Hog Heaven, Veg Head, nachos, and Chipotle Polka. All of the sandwiches are served with a mix of russet fries and sweet potato fries, and lots of people pay the extra $2 to get all sweet potato fries because they're amazing. To be honest, you can't go wrong with anything on the menu!

3. If you want to try 100+ beers/whiskeys, go to Fuel. They have "Beer Bibles" to keep track of which ones you've tried, and you make it on the wall when you get to a certain number. 

The atmosphere at Fuel is dark and sometimes loud, and the servers are quick and no-nonsense. Try it out to see for yourself!

This will always be my favorite go-to late- night college student food spot! It has a fun, underground vibe, and with half price meals after 11 pm it's perfect for a college student.

The best dishes are:
- Smashed Potato pizza: It is so good! By far the best thing on the menu. Actually me and my boyfriend like this so much that we've even tried to recreate it! 
- Skinny dip: Replace the chips for the delicious sweet potato fries! They go really well with this spicy buffalo chicken dip
- Turkey wrap: For the days you're not feeling adventurous or want to pretend to be healthy - it's still pretty good though!

The wings are good too but I wouldn't try to explore this menu too much after that (the rest of it isn't that great). A lot of the dishes here are pretty hit or miss.

A few cons: After 11 pm this place gets ridiculously crowded. If you have more than 4 people in your group you'll be waiting for at least 45 minutes even if you show up 15 minutes before half price time to put your name in for a table. But I suppose time is the price you pay to get your food half price. Also I am not a big fan of the bar - I ordered a drink here once and the bartender took what was nearly double the price of the drink and didn't give me any change assuming it was a tip! I tried to get her attention a few times to no avail.

Although I would not come here full price (after paying half-price for so long), this was a great place to hang out with college friends and eat some cool eclectic food!
Awesome food! I had the mashed potato pizza, which was one of the most guilty cheesy treats I've ever had. And I tried a little of my sister's nachos - awesome :) All the food is simply amazing!

Always a pleasure. One of the best beer selections in town. Relativity simple bar food menu, but the food is excellent. Very friendly service (particularly for Oakland ). Can't go wrong here, great place

Fuel and fuddle is great. I've been there three times, and had different experiences. The first time when I went with a small group, I love it the burger was delicious and their sweet potato fries is everything! I love it. The second times I went with a group of six and they seat us down in the basement. For some reasons, maybe the server forgot about us but we waited forever for the food and for our water to be refilled. I didn't have a good experience. However, the third times I went with a group of 12 and we were again seated in the basement but food came out quick and everything was tasty. The only reason I didn't give them a four stars is that one experience and also I like BRGR or burgatory better. The food was great, but it wasn't Outstanding. I would go back if I'm around the area and someone wants to go, but it's not somewhere I want to go specifically!

I had the steak burger ($9) and it was quite good. They actually made it medium rare (I've had trouble getting anything rarer than medium in Pittsburgh when I order medium rare). It comes on a long soft, roll- it's definitely different, but palatable nonetheless. The burger had a nice char on the outside and was still juicy on the inside. It came with a mix of regular fries and sweet potato and those were a nice touch. I had a brown ale of sorts ($4.50) and it was not too malty and not too heavy. Service was quick and the staff was helpful.

What do I love about Fuel & Fuddle? I love the kinda massive selection of beer.
I love the appetizers: Skinny Dip (a nice take on Buffalo chicken dip) fire baked Brie and the nachos.
What do I like about Fuel & Fuddle? Sierra grilled chicken and campfire steak and potatoes.
Lots on the menu to choose from so definitely need to get back and try more.

Excellent management and hard-working staff. A relaxed and casual vibe with delicious and creative foods and unique drinks and beers. We love the new quinoa burgers! Try the sweet potato fries too. A go-to, never-disappointing spot!
